related_post.text: > @petr By class object you mean the instance? Well `sys.getsizeof` doesn't return _all_ the memory occupied by the object. It doesn't include the memory occupied by the object's dependent objects (i.e. its attributes and their dependent objects). So here> well how much memory is occupied by `a` and how much memory is occupied by `b`? Is it 48 for each of them or is it (48 + size of `numbers`) for each of them? > > Also see: <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/33978/findouthowmuchmemoryisbeingusedbyanobjectinpython>@fix error oh I see thanks. I meant (48 + size of `numbers`)

so_post.text: > @petr By class object you mean the instance? Well `sys.getsizeof` doesn't return _all_ the memory occupied by the object. It doesn't include the memory occupied by the object's dependent objects (i.e. its attributes and their dependent objects). So here> well how much memory is occupied by `a` and how much memory is occupied by `b`? Is it 48 for each of them or is it (48 + size of `numbers`) for each of them? > > Also see: <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/33978/findouthowmuchmemoryisbeingusedbyanobjectinpython>@fix error oh I see thanks. I meant (48 + size of `numbers`)
